objective: Update PowerShell to version 7.5.4 and Pester to latest version (5.7.1) across the codebase

context.trigger: User request to upgrade PowerShell and Pester versions
context.scope: Update CI workflows, documentation, installation scripts, and verify compatibility

work_log.details: Created session log, verified branch status, reviewed memory context
Verified PowerShell 7.5.4 availability (released 2025-10-20). Confirmed Pester 5.7.1 is latest (published 2025-01-08).
Updated 9 documentation files with new version requirements
Ran all Pester tests: 619 passed, 0 failed. Fixed markdown duplicate heading lint error.

decisions.rationale: User requested specific version, need to verify availability and update locations
PSGallery shows 5.7.1 as latest published 2025-01-08, no update needed for Pester

outcomes: PowerShell version requirement updated from 7.4+/7.0+ to 7.5.4+ across all documentation
Pester version requirement updated from 5.6+/5.x to 5.7.1+ across all documentation
All Pester tests pass with version 5.7.1 (619 passed, 0 failed)
Markdown linting passes with no errors

session.objective: Update PowerShell to version 7.5.4+ and Pester to 5.7.1+ across the codebase

memory_updated.evidence: No memory updates needed for version bumps

session_end.handoff_notes: PowerShell and Pester versions updated across documentation. No CI workflow changes needed as Pester is already at 5.7.1 in setup-code-env action. PowerShell 7.5.4 is available but not yet enforced in CI - recommend follow-up to update GitHub Actions runner versions.
